text.sentence: just in case, i do not know how everyone feels about this but i still got 2 tee times at brock on saturday at 8:40 & 8:48.
let me know.
if people do not want to play golf i suggest we all go to breakast or have lunch I would just like ot see and talk to everyone b/c you never know when we might not be able to
I luv you guys
Good idea, Dutch.
Yesenia, Xavy and I will have all of you in our prayers.
We will be in Missouri for our vacation.
This show how truly sick and evil people can be, but also show how the good of everyone can come together in moments of tragedy.
Our thoughts and prayers are with those that have been personally affected by this event.
I can't imagine having to explain this to children.
I would still like to play golf this weekend b/c it is the friendship that is fun I might even take on Ernesto for the Brock dog challenge
It is truly sick what happened , I was talking to a broker that was in the second world trade tower as it got hit and he was describing what was going on.
Several people I know made it out of both buildings but many are not yet accounted for , so at this time all there is is hope.
text.signature: May everyone have a peaceful day Dutch

text.sentence: i'd like to play also and we could still have dinner together.
i too want to tell everyone how important all of you are to me, seeing as i rarely see anyone in my family (it's been almost 4 years since i've seen my mom) and you guys are basically family to me.
i'm just glad that none of you were on the east coast.
let me know.
think about it brock dogs in the morning to clog up both your arteries and anus!! yummy!!!
I definitely want to play so let me know if you can tomorrow if we are for sure.
I can't say anything that hasn't been said already.
However, I will add that we DO need to get on and enjoy our freedom.
Too many times we take something so simple as our freedom for granted.
Our generation has never seen anything like this and I would hope that our children will not have to ever experience the feelings that we as a nation have endured the past 36 hours.
I love my country, I love my family and friends, but most of all I love Brock dogs.
Bring it on!!
In the words inscribed at the Korean War Memorial in Washington which I was priviledged to visit this past summer, "Freedom is not Free"
text.signature: ernie As for dinner plans, I cannot make it on Saturday evening.

text.sentence: so far it look like: kevin, ernie, mark, dutch, richard, myself & jerry?????, my friend christian might go.
if not i'd like to get an eighth or a seventh since i don't know where lawyer-boy is and if he can go.
